summary: This is a transcript of a voluntary sworn interview conducted by the DOJ Office of the Inspector General (OIG) with a Federal Bureau of Prisons Associate Warden regarding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York on August 10, 2019. The interview covers the circumstances surrounding Epstein's incarceration, the July 23, 2019 incident with cellmate Tartaglione, Epstein's placement on suicide watch, the requirement for him to have a cellmate, the transfer of his cellmate Efrain Reyes on August 9, 2019, staff failures to conduct rounds and counts, issues with the MCC's camera system, and the witness's assessment of contributing factors to Epstein's death.

events.title: Epstein ligature incident with Tartaglione
events.description: Incident in the SHU where inmate Tartaglione called for assistance because Epstein was attempting suicide with a ligature. Epstein was removed from the SHU and placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Epstein removed from suicide watch
events.description: Epstein was removed from suicide watch/psychological observation and placed back in the SHU. Psychology recommended he have a cellmate.

events.title: Cellmate Reyes transferred
events.description: Efrain Reyes was transferred from the MCC to a GEO facility (With All Belongings - WAB), leaving Epstein without his required cellmate. A court production list indicated the transfer.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein found deceased
events.description: At approximately 6:33 a.m., SHU staff found Jeffrey Epstein unresponsive in his cell. CPR was initiated. He was pronounced dead at 7:36 a.m.

keyFacts: The Associate Warden confirmed that psychology had recommended Jeffrey Epstein have a cellmate at all times while in the SHU, and that SHU staff were aware of this requirement.
Epstein's cellmate, Efrain Reyes, was transferred out of the MCC on August 9, 2019 (With All Belongings - WAB), not released from court as some initially believed, leaving Epstein without a cellmate.

SHU staff failed to conduct required rounds and cell searches on August 9-10, 2019. The witness had overheard SHU staff discussing the cellmate requirement but could not confirm if the specific officers on duty knew.

There were significant issues with the MCC's camera recording system. Two hard drives were down, stopping recording for half the institution's cameras, including in the SHU. New camera equipment had been on site since October 2018 but was not installed until after Epstein's death.

The witness gathered documentation after Epstein's death, including a 'court documentation regarding WAB' for Reyes, indicating she had evidence of the transfer on August 9, though she could not later locate the specific document.
